Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Vixen \Vix"en\, n. [AS. fixen a she-fox, for fyxen, fem. of fox. See {Fox}.] 1. A female fox. [Obs. or Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
2. A cross, ill-tempered person; -- formerly used of either sex, now only of a woman. --Barrow. [1913 Webster]
She was a vixen when she went to school. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
vixen n : a malicious fierce-tempered woman [syn: {harpy}, {hellcat}]
